result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan T Huerta

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan T Huerta in court, in custody.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Juan T Huerta.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Juan T Huerta appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Juan T Huerta.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
*AMENDED 10-18-2022: DEFENDANT MUST POST $100 CASH (ADJUSTED DOWN FROM $500).

Defendant Juan T Huerta in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman for defendant. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Hagerman, State objects. Argument, granted. Amended down to $100 cash, same conditions.  Status Hearing set October 25, 2022, at 8:30 a.m.
Signature bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

*AMENDED 10-18-2022: DEFENDANT MUST POST $100 CASH (ADJUSTED DOWN FROM $500).

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 22CM510 & 22GF1047
Must post $500.00 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH THOMAS MOTEL, UNLESS THEY AGREE IN WRITING TO THE DEFENDANT STAYING THERE. NO CONTACT WITH A.I.B. dob 3-2-2001 OR P.P. dob 12-20-1996 Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-4759 & 22-4760

Defendant Juan Huerta present in court, in custody via video with attorney Grace Hagerman. Prior bond forfeited. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Juan T Huerta not in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Juan T Huerta.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
